alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 10:13AM EST until further notice by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Maryland... Monocacy River near Frederick affecting Frederick MD zone. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Monocacy River near Frederick. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Two low-water crossings, one on Michaels Mill Road /State Route 880/ in Buckeystown, and one on Retreat Road north of Frederick, begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 4.0 feet, or 11.0 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Tue Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7PM 1AM 7AM Stg Time Date Monocacy River Frederick 15.0 4.0 Tue 9 am 8.3 11.4 13.4 14.3 1pm Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM EST.
